home-page.about-us.text:
The Regional History Museum "Stoyu Shishkov" - Smolyan is the largest museum in the Middle Rhodopes. It preserves the material memory of the inhabitants of the highest parts of the mountain through different historical periods, from prehistoric times to the present day.

It is housed in a purpose-built building, located in the modern administrative center of the city and has rich and diverse collections, amounting to over 150 thousand items.

about-us.shishkov.modal.title: Stoyo Nedelchev Shishkov
about-us.shishkov.modal.text:
was born on July 27, 1865 in Ustovo in the family of a small craftsman and trader. At only fourteen years old (1879) he began his teaching career at the school of the "Holy Virgin" church in Ustovo. He continued this activity until 1927, teaching in various places over the years - besides Ustovo, in Orekhovo, Chepelare, Asenovgrad, and Plovdiv.

At the same time, Stoyu Shishkov was actively engaged in scientific-educational, economic, journalistic, and publishing activities. He was the founder and editor of the earliest Rhodope periodicals: "Rhodope Antiquities" magazine (1887-1892), "Nightingale Forests" magazine (1894), "Rhodope Progress" magazine (1903-1912). He also dedicated numerous independent publications to the Rhodopes, most of which he financed himself. His contribution as a researcher of the Rhodopes and Thrace is invaluable. He left a huge legacy for generations in the fields of ethnography, folklore, linguistics, demography, history and particularly economic history, and museum work.

Through all his social, cultural and educational activities, his active civic position and his in-depth studies of the past of the Rhodope region, Stoyu Shishkov brilliantly defended the Bulgarian national cause. On May 26, 1935, during the celebration in honor of his 70th birthday and half a century of cultural activity held in Plovdiv, Stoyu Shishkov donated 50,000 leva for the creation of an Ethnographic Museum in his native Ustovo. Two years later, the Ministry of Education approved the museum regulations prepared by Shishkov.

He died on December 27, 1937 in Plovdiv.

about-us.history.title: History
about-us.history.text:
On May 26, 1935, during the celebration of Stoyu Shishkov's jubilee, dedicated to his half-century of public service and 70 years since his birth, he announced his idea to establish a museum in his native Ustovo. For "building a hall in which to organize the Middle Rhodope and Thracian ethnographic museum," the jubilee celebrant made a personal donation of 50 thousand gold leva. A month later, the funds were deposited in the Ustovo Popular Bank to the account of the "Progress" community center for organizing the museum. By Order No. 1141 of May 8, 1937, the Minister of Public Education approved the regulations of the Ethnographic Museum in the village of Ustovo. Based on the special instruction from the end of 1951 for the preservation of cultural monuments and the development of museum work in Bulgaria of the Committee for Science, Art and Culture, the Rhodope Folk Museum was established in the village of Raikovo, whose activity was initially ethnographic in direction, but gradually historical, archaeological and art departments were opened.
 In 1967, the museum was transformed into a District Historical Museum.
Since 2002, the History Museum in Smolyan has been officially named after its founder Stoyu Shishkov, and since 2006 it has performed regional functions in the territory of Smolyan Oblast. In terms of thematic scope, it is general historical.

about-us.building.title: THE BUILDING
about-us.building.text:
In 1983, the museum was established in a purpose-designed building located in the newly built center of united Smolyan, part of the Cultural Complex. The three emblematic cultural institutions of the city - museum, library, and gallery - are located above the pedestrian zone of the amphitheater and water cascade, at a characteristic location from the viewpoint of the terrain topography with a dominant presence of the majestic Rhodope nature.

The design team of the Cultural Complex was headed by architect Antoaneta Brambarova, one of the authors of the overall urban planning solution for the center of Smolyan, commissioned to a team led by architect Stoicho Velkovski from KNIPIAT "Glavproekt".

The total area of the museum building is 3,410 m2, of which 1,300 m2 are exhibition halls; 420 m2 - foyers and spaces for temporary exhibitions; 500 m2 - storage facilities; 150 m2 - workshops, laboratories for restoration, conservation and photography.

the-international-museum-day: 18th of May – The International Museum Day
the-international-museum-day-text:
The International Museum Day on the 18 May was celebrated for the first time in 1978. The International Council for Museums (ICOM) took its decision about it at the Eleventh Conference General held in Moscow in 1977. Since 1992 the International Museum Day has had different specific themes. The theme for 2010 is "Museums for Social Harmony".

The event provides the opportunity for various initiatives presenting museums as an important means of cultural exchange and enrichment promoting communication, understanding, cooperation and peace among peoples. ICOM defines museums as 'an institution in the service of society and of its development' and the events organized at or about 18 May provide the opportunity for museum professionals to meet the public and alert them to the challenges that museums face in our globalized world.

On this day, museums provide the public with free access to the cultural heritage and to the various initiatives organized.
the-european-heritage-days-text:
The European Heritage Days started in France during the 80s of the 20th century. The initiative "Open Doors Days" was launched there providing access to cultural heritage sites. Gradually, other European countries joined, each of them contributing to the diversity of the Heritage Days.

Since 1991, the European Heritage Days have become a joint action of the European Council and the European Union celebrated in almost all European countries.

Bulgaria has participated actively in the EHD since 1999. There is a specific theme for every year and 2010 is the International Year of Biodiversity. Since the first year of EHD in Bulgaria, the Regional Museum of History Stoyu Shishkov, together with the municipality and other partner organizations, has been developing and implementing programmes targeted at the local community and at visitors to the town and the municipality.

In 2001, Smolyan hosted the official launch of the national campaign "European Heritage Days" under the motto "Different ethnicities and religions – a common heritage" (28-30 September 2002).

permanent-exhibitions-text:
The spatial composition of the exhibit display shows variety with the ethnographic complex (Rhodopes fleecy rugs and sheep bells)located at the entrance of the hall which illustrates the idea of the cosmic heights that human culture is able to reach, of its all-pervasiveness, and of its ability to keep and hand down its values through time and space.
The museum halls will give you the unforgettable experience of seeing, touching and getting enchanted by the wealth and uniqueness of the colours of the mountain and of the mastery of the Rhodopes craftsmen, while the cosmic chimes of the 100 sheep bells will fascinate you with the originality of their music.
permanent-exhibitions-text-come: A visit to the Regional Museum of History Stoyu Shishkov, Smolyan is the easiest way for you to get acquainted with the millennial history of the Middle Rhodopes, preserved over the centuries into the present and well-kept for the future.

workshops-text:
Museum workshops aim to deepen knowledge of history and culture, acquire new knowledge and skills, and provide entertainment during free time. Offered to different social audiences on various topics, the most popular are those related to traditions and customs, local studies and genealogy. The most active participants are young people.

Within the workshop, participants gain knowledge through lectures, talks and presentations and contact with authentic samples;

They learn how to work in the specialized library and archive of the museum; they improve their activities and acquire dexterity and skills. Participants receive materials, competent help from experts and opportunities for expression. They have the right to produce the assigned tasks for their own needs, to have their authorship announced, to invite and include their friends in the initiative, to return multiple times.
routes-text: April-October, from Tuesday to Saturday, only by advance booking (one week in advance) for Bulgarian and English-speaking groups (minimum 10 people). Times are determined by agreement with the group. We offer guide services only.

collections-virtual-subtitle: Over the years, the museum in Smolyan has accumulated rich and diverse collections, amounting to over 150 thousand items in the main, auxiliary and exchange fund.
photo-archive-text: The Museum's Photo archive stocks more than 100 000 negatives, slides, films and video cassettes that have captured moments from the life of the local community, have preserved the cultural and historical heritage of the Middle Rhodopes, and have stored moments from the typical museum work such as archaeological excavations, field work, displays and exhibitions, conferences, meetings etc. These photo materials were prepared by the museum photographers over the years as well as by renowned masters of the art of photography in Bulgaria such as Peter Frantz, Aleksi Aleksiev, Rumen Baykov, Yavor Popov, Toroz Horosyan, and Krum Yanev. There are also photos by Krum Savov, a well-known photographer from the beginning of the 20th century, who was the first photojournalist from the Rhodopes to be granted prestigious international awards. The Photo Archive contents data is being stored into an electronic file. The museum has the necessary equipment and has started the digitization of the negatives and slides.
library-text:
The museum library has over 13 500 volumes of specialized literature mainly in its history, archaeology, ethnography, art and local studies sections. The library collection is regularly replenished through exchange, donations or purchase of books from academic publishing houses. Subscription to national and regional periodicals such as Historical Review, History, The Past, Archive Review, State Archive Publications, Monuments, Museums and Restoration, Bulgarian Ethnology, Bulgarian Folklore, All About Weapons, The Rhodopes and others.
Besides being an important unit for the research work of the museum experts, the library is also available, under specific conditions, to scientists, teachers, university and high school students, local studies experts and genealogy researchers.
The library has an electronic catalogue and access to Internet.

regulation-text:
1. Format

  • MUSEUM GAMES OF PATRIOTISM is a team competition between two teams CHETNIKS AND COMITES, consisting of 6 participants each.
  • The competition takes place in 4 games, entitled:
    • HEROES OF BULGARIA;
    • GREAT HISTORICAL EVENTS;
    • MUSEUM TREASURES;
    • ARRANGE THE PUZZLES "VIEWS FROM THE SMOLYAN MUSEUM".
  • The goals in the competition are:
    • to recognize the most significant Bulgarian historical figures by their portraits and brief description;
    • to determine the years of great historical events for our country;
    • to discover museum valuables by their description;
    • to arrange puzzles with images of highlights in the museum exhibition.
  • On a stand, 6 boards are arranged, and each participant receives a sign that must be placed at the correct board. In the fourth game for arranging puzzles, participants compete in pairs to arrange a total of 3 puzzles for each team.
  • Teams compete for time. Seconds measure the total time of teams. The end of the game is when the last sixth player crosses the start-finish line. In the fourth game, after the judge accepts the puzzle as correctly arranged, the pair of competitors places it on the stand and passes the relay to the next pair of players. The end of the game is when the last, third, pair of competitors crosses the start-finish line.
  • The winner is the team that has most quickly and correctly matched names with portraits, events with years, exhibits with their description, arranged the puzzles.

2. Participants

  • Participants in Museum Games of Patriotism can be teams of students from grades 4 to 12.
  • Younger students and children can compete together with their parents or relatives. Then teams will be formed of 6 families each.

3. Organization and conduct

  • The team of RHM "Stoyu Shishkov" - Smolyan organizes and conducts the Museum Games of Patriotism, and for the purposes of the competition the following are designated: judge, seconds, knowledge girls, host, secretary and assistant.
  • The date, place and time of the games are determined by the participants and organizers with a specific agreement and in compliance with mutual interest.
  • The duration is approximately one astronomical hour.
  • The materials for the GAMES are prepared by the organizers - RHM "Stoyu Shishkov" - Smolyan.
  • Participation is free.
  • Applications for participation are submitted to the email address: muzei-obrazovanie@abv.bg, by phone 0301/62727, 0879111913, 0879111915, as well as to the museum guides. If teams are not formed in advance, they are determined by the organizers according to the individual applications submitted.
  • Before the start of each competition, participants are registered and marked with badges with their names.
  • A draw is held to determine the team name: CHETNIKS or COMITES
  • Participants are distinguished with special honorary ribbons with the team name.

4. Evaluation

  • After each game, teams are evaluated using a point system:
  • For speed: winning team – 3 points; second place team – 2 points
  • For accuracy: for each correct answer – 1 point, maximum total 6 points
  • The overall score is the sum of points for speed and accuracy, maximum 9 points
  • In the fourth game "Arrange the puzzles 'Views from the Smolyan Museum'" only speed is evaluated for consecutively solving three puzzles for each team: for winners – 3 points, for runners-up 2 points.

5. Ranking

  • Ranking is based on the total points received by each team after the four games.
  • In case of a tie, a fifth game is played: Arranging one puzzle assigned by the opposing team. The winner is the team that arranged the puzzle and crossed the start-finish line faster than the other team.

6. Awards

  • Each participant in Museum Games of Patriotism receives a diploma.
  • Competitors from the winning team receive medals with the title WINNER, and competitors from the team that placed second receive medals with the title RUNNER-UP.

museum-games-title: The Museum Games of Patriotism have begun

The first Museum Games of Patriotism have started. The first edition of the innovative event was dedicated to November 1 – Day of the National Enlighteners and was held with teams of fifth-graders from "Father Paisii" Secondary School – Smolyan. The CHETNIKS and COMITES teams had an extremely contested competition and after four games: HEROES OF BULGARIA, GREAT HISTORICAL EVENTS, MUSEUM TREASURES and ARRANGE THE PUZZLES "VIEWS FROM THE SMOLYAN MUSEUM", finishing tied, they played an additional fifth game, won by the CHETNIKS.

The Chetniks were also winners in the second direction of the Games of Patriotism, in which families participate – younger children with their parents.

All 45 participants received medals and diplomas, wonderful impressions and memories, and the satisfaction of the museum specialists is that all competitors showed excellent knowledge of Bulgarian history, did not make a single mistake in the games, and the winners and runners-up were determined by faster puzzle arrangement.

collection.archeology.subtitle: The "Archaeology" Fund was established after 1959. It receives movable cultural valuables from systematic and rescue archaeological excavations, accidental finds, donations and purchases.
collection.description:
The earliest (so far) material evidence of human presence in the Middle Rhodopes (Smolyan Oblast) dates from the Late Paleolithic. They were recorded during the study of flint deposits near Orpheus Hut in Devin Mountain, from which material was extracted for the production of tools and weapons. Archaeological research shows that the high mountain part of the Rhodopes was permanently settled during the Late Eneolithic. Evidence of this has been discovered in cave dwellings (Yagodina Cave, Haramiyska Dupka, Uleya Cave near the village of Mogilitsa, etc.), and in recent years also in open-air dwellings (at Suhia Peak near the village of Beden and in the village of Dolna Dryanka, Banite Municipality). They are represented by ceramic vessels, stone and bone tools, idols and amulets. Of particular interest is the pottery painted with graphite paint and ochre.

The Late Bronze and Early Iron Ages are represented by artifacts – grave inventory and grave offerings, acquired during the study of the mound and flat necropolises near Borino, Lyubcha, Devin, Progled, Chepelare, etc., as well as materials from rock sanctuaries in the Middle Rhodopes – near Beden, Sivino, Strashimir, Bosilkovo, Startsevo, etc.

The Antiquity period is represented by materials from the studies of the necropolises near Barutin, Borino, Grohotno, Devin, Beden, Gela, Stoikite. Of interest are the "ceramics" and "jewelry" collections.

The finds from the medieval period were acquired during the study of necropolises (Borino, Devin, Beden, Zlatograd, etc.), Christian temples (the basilicas in Barutin, Gela and Smolyan) and military fortresses near Beden, Smolyan, Podvis, Rudozem. The most numerous is the collection of jewelry: earrings, pendants, necklaces, bracelets and rings. Of particular interest are archaeological finds illustrating cases of crypto-Christianity, most of which were recorded in the necropolis near the village of Borino.
